question: Which of the following git command that downloads your repository from GitHub to your local machine?
Which of the following git command can be used to check the stored stashes?
Which is used to reference cloned remote repository?
git fetch + git merge equal to?
Looking at the following commands, describe what is happening. git checkout feature-user-location git cherry-pick kj2342134sdf090093f0sdgasdf99sdfo992mmmf9921231
options: The commit is being tagged for release on the feature-user-location branch
A commit is being copied from its original branch over to the feature-user-location branch
The commit is being cherry picked as the new HEAD of the commit history
The branch is switched to the feature-user-location branch, and the specified commit is applied to the branch.

question: Your team lead needs a list of all commits that will be moved before you perform a rebase. Which command can you use to access that information?
While modifying a file, you're unexpectedly assigned an urgent bug fix on another branch. How can you temporarily save your local work without committing?
options: This is not possible, as you cannot save locally without committing.
Run git hold to save a local copy of what you're doing to return to later.
Save your work with git local-cache.
Use git stash to save your work and come back later and reapply the stashed commit.
